Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png
Norman
A long, long time ago...
Norman
There was a bunch of happy rabbits. Every day they enjoyed a meal of carrots that grew from the earth. Their lives were blissful, free from worry.
Norman
One day, they discovered that carrots bathed in the moonlight would become even sweeter and tastier. The gears in their little brains started turning...
Norman
Wouldn't it be great if we could eat these extra sweet carrots all the time? "Why don't we just keep the Moon with us, then?"
Norman
How would we do that? "Hold her back! Hold her back!" "Grab a rope! Let's pull the Moon back!"
Norman
Eager to taste the sweetest carrots ever, the rabbits worked together, twisting and weaving the carrot leaves until they made a long, long rope.
Norman
Hi-yah! Hi-yah! They finally grabbed ahold of the Moon. Using their combined might, the rabbits tried their hardest to tie down the Moon in the sky.
Norman
We'll soon get our bellies full! "We'll soon get our bellies full!" The rabbits cheered and chanted...
Norman
Did they... actually get what they hoped for in the end?
Norman
Hmph... well...
A New Divide
Chapter 19
Assets/Product/Texture/Atlas/CommonLogo/BgLogo1.png
ThemeEnable
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory524.jpg

It has been a while since Gray Raven returned to Babylonia with the survivors. The doctor from Star of Life said you started sleeping since Liv reverted to the Eclipse frame, so you have no idea how much time has passed.
You were seemingly heavily infected when you retrieved Liv's M.I.N.D. shards... so much so that despite getting her back, you fell unconscious while she changed her frame.
Hippocrates
You suffered a deadly concussion... I know you've miraculously awakened, but the truth is I wasn't expecting you to wake up at all.
Making comprehensive notes on your report, the Star of Life doctor frowns as she goes over the thorough records.
Hippocrates

Your Mind Beacon is still slightly corrupted, and your body is still covered in old injuries, so you're not leaving until I say otherwise... Stay in the rehabilitation room instead of going on missions if possible.
Alright.
If possible...
Hippocrates
Also... don't walk around on your own just because you're feeling a bit better. You hear me?
You feel a surge of embarrassment as the doctor departs with a distrustful gaze. A familiar voice speaks beside you.
Simon
You heard the doc... Get some rest, Chief. Just ask me if you need something.
Simon closes the book he is reading and turns to look at you with kindness. He is similarly covered in injuries, but he looks well.
You're looking pretty lively today, Simon.
Simon
Yeah. They're probably discharging me tomorrow after the inspection today... HQ told me that they'd assign Dark Aries with new members after I'm ready.
...Are you staying in the army?
Simon is not as adamant as other soldiers, and there does not seem to be a reason he must stay in the army. After that excruciating battle, no one would bat an eye if he applied for early retirement.
Simon
Haha... I suppose someone like me, who always got last place, doesn't make the most reliable commandant, does it...
I didn't mean that...
Smiling with a hint of embarrassment, Simon fiddles with his book before revealing a resolute gaze you have never seen.
Simon
This is a textbook from F.O.S. College. I never really read through it back in school, which would explain my grade...
Simon
But if I can start learning new tactics and considering new perspectives... perhaps I will save a lot more lives in the future—just like you guys did, Chief.
You will, Simon.
Simon
...Yeah. Thank you.
Right, didn't you say I could ask you if I need something?
Simon
Of course! What do you need?
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory284.jpg
Simon
...A-are you sure this is fine? The doctor told you not to walk around...
You wrap your arm around Simon's shoulder, walking along a corridor in the Star of Life medical center while your whole body is in pain.
She said not to walk around "on my own."
Simon
T-that's why you're the Chief... You've clearly twisted her words, but I'm still convinced.

Lucia's and Lee's frames were heavily damaged after the battle, their M.I.N.D.s showing signs of infection. Still, repaired and examined, they have since recovered and started going on missions with other squads.

You worry most about Liv... She switched to the specialized frame without a commandant to stabilize her M.I.N.D., and now the damage has put her in a coma, her treatment marred by the unknown qualities of her new frame.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory16.jpg
Simon
We're here, Chief.
Stopping before an ICU ward, you look through its thick glass window and see Liv surrounded by a lot of medical devices.
Simon
Liv... saved everyone back there. I'm sure she will be fine.
Without her risking her life, no one would have survived that encounter—not Lucia, Lee, or even the entire human race. Not to mention this moment of respite she has given you all.
But the girl who saved the world is now slumbering here, and the only thing anyone can do is pray.
Liv
Liv...
Simon
We probably felt the same when you were in a coma, Chief.
Her condition will not get any better with you staying by her side and doing nothing. Those who can still contribute should act.
Let's go back.
Simon
Alright. You still have physical therapy this afternoon. The doctors are going to be mad if you miss it again...
Simon suddenly stops, recalling something.
Simon
By the way, Chief, do you know a Construct from the Engineering Force... named "Karenina"?
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory427.jpg
Hilda
Hassen
Norman
Nikola
I'm sorry, Mr. Representative from Norman Mining Corp...
Norman
Leonardo Norman, but Norman will do. That's the name people know, after all.

Norman Mining Corp controlled almost every mining operation on the surface back in the Golden Age. After Babylonia retreated to space, it gave up its operations on Earth and turned its gaze toward the Moon.
The rich Helium-3 reserve on the Moon is what powers Babylonia every day. It is even used to trade for essentials with earthbound organizations like the ACA.
On the other hand, Norman Mining Corp's comprehensive knowledge of the surface also makes it an important partner of the WGAA.
Nikola
Councilman Norman, this is a very important meeting... We don't need you telling us a bedtime story here.
Norman
C'mon, everyone's so serious right now. I thought I'd lighten the mood, no?
The other council members sigh and sneer, not worrying that Norman can hear them—but Norman does not react. He seems to be familiar with this kind of response.
Norman Mining Corp has never been interested in politics, but they have sent the infamously perverse eldest son of the family to this council meeting for some reason.
Nikola sighs while Hassen nods, crossing his arms, intrigued.
Hassen
So... did the rabbits pull the Moon back in the end?
Norman
Oh. Well, they were rabbits, weren't they... Of course they couldn't pull off a stunt like that. That would be ridiculous.
Nikola
Unlike the part where they grabbed ahold of the Moon with a rope...
Norman ignores Nikola's interruption and continues, chuckling.
Norman

But the sweet, sweet carrots were all the rabbits could think about, so they wouldn't let go of their rope. Eventually, the Moon pulled them away, and the rabbits ended up on the surface of the Moon, never to return.
Norman
So what? The rabbits wouldn't worry about that, obviously. They honestly thought the Moon was theirs! They cheered triumphantly—after all... they were just a bunch of happy rabbits.
Hilda
Are you suggesting that humans are those dumb rabbits...?
Norman
No, no, no. This is just a popular fairy tale where I came from—and I didn't think the rabbits were stupid, either.
Norman bows elegantly, his etiquette clashing with his flamboyant outfit.
Hassen
Cool story, Councilman Norman.
Norman
Yeah, y'know, my sisters always call me a good storyteller.
Hassen politely smiles before turning back to the spacious Parliament Hall and nodding, and the annoyed council members gradually quiet down.
Hassen

This has been a very intense meeting, so thank you, Councilman Norman, for the brief amusement. But I'm afraid we must return to the matter at hand... how we are going to save humanity from our biggest threat yet.
The holo-screen in the hall displays the destruction caused by the global mutation of the Hetero-Creatures.
Nikola

Although we've finally found ourselves possessing a weapon that can counter the twins and large-scale Punishing Virus infections with the new specialized frame deployed, earning us a difficult victory...
Nikola
But the development of specialized frames continues to be riddled with problems. The research on how to stabilize them, in particular, will be our key to reclaiming the earth in the future.
Nikola and Hassen exchange a look, and Hassen continues.
Hassen
This catastrophe has greatly impaired the Task Force members deployed to the surface... Some teams never returned.
Hassen
Confronting an unexpected calamity, they chose to stand and fight on the frontline for humanity... buying us the time to plan and strategize right now.
All the council members remain silent. Some look upset, probably suffering from loss, while some look terrified, fearing that the coming war will cost them everything they have...
Amidst all of them, one person raises his hand and stands up.
Nikola
(He's... a member of the Diplomatic Court. Kurono. One of Collins'.)
Hassen and Nikola exchange a look. Frowning slightly, Hassen gestures to the man.
Hassen
Councilman Liszt from the Diplomatic Court. The floor is yours.
Liszt nods before entering some data on the screen next to him, projecting them onto the holo-screen.
Liszt
According to the information the military has published, our Task Force—when compared with the data of previous battles—is spent way beyond what is acceptable.
Liszt

Given their current strength, dare I say that the Task Force can't even guard Babylonia against the evolving Hetero-Creatures. Destroying them on a meaningful scale and reclaiming the conservation areas is a pipe dream.
Liszt pauses, his gaze sweeping across the hall, and he lets the deafening silence flood the room.
Liszt
I have no intention to blame the military command or our Task Force... but even with their exceptional service, our fight against the Punishing Virus is still resulting in heavy loss.
Liszt

Indeed. The battles are much crueler than these numbers. Constructs and commandants were performing their duties to reclaim the earth when they met their ill-fated ends, combating enemies beyond our understanding.
Liszt
They are glorious worries, are they not? The children of Earth, just like us, are they not? They have every right to share in humanity's future...
Nikola
Are you suggesting giving up on reclaiming Earth? Are you going to let their sacrifices be in vain?
Looking into Liszt's eyes intently, Nikola has a feeling that this man must have a card up his sleeve. He would not have incited the council members otherwise.
Liszt
I don't object to reclaiming the earth. It is our past—our future, even! But we must ask ourselves: is it time for us to consider another path?
Hilda

If we stop fighting and let the Punishing Virus spread, the people will suffer, and Babylonia won't remain unscathed. We can't be sure that the fully evolved Hetero-Creatures and Corrupted wouldn't destroy this ark.
Liszt
Don't forget that Babylonia was created as a superluminal colony ship. It's a ship that's meant to sail toward the stars, not an ark to survive a flood.
Nikola chuckles. If that is Liszt's card, he might be a little too naive.
Nikola

Since you didn't forget, I'm sure you'll also recall that Babylonia can only run on regular fuel right now. The zero-point engine designed to power Babylonia originally was the reason this apocalypse started.
Liszt
What if...
Liszt's dreadful noise follows Nikola's words like a cobra catching its prey.
Liszt
What if I tell you that the utilization of zero-point energy is no longer a dream?
After a brief silence, the room explodes with questions. All the council members are stunned by Liszt's words, eager to know more about the thing he said—zero-point energy.
Liszt
As you all know, during a not-so-secret military operation, the Gray Raven Commandant retrieved a file from Atlantis, the zero-point research city.
Liszt changes the displayed content on the holo-screen into the Omega File, the data with which the Atlantis researchers trade their lives.
Liszt
This is an incredibly valuable file. It shows us that, under specific conditions, a running zero-point reactor can create a field that "absorbs" the Punishing Virus.
Nikola
That was how we managed to create the specialized frame with the Omega Weapon that defeated the twins.
The new specialized frame was what caused the military to work with Kurono.
Liszt
Exactly. However... those noble researchers have perhaps left us with an even more significant insight.
Nodding, Liszt turns to the next page of his presentation.
Liszt
During their research, they tried to recreate the process of how the zero-point reactor created the Punishing Virus. They documented their experiments, hoping to leave behind valuable data.
Liszt
While they never saw the virus manifest, those researchers still preserved the Omega File alongside all the data from running their zero-point reactor.
Hilda also realizes what Liszt is suggesting.
Hilda
Which means that, in a way, they discovered how to generate zero-point energy without causing a Punishing Virus outbreak...
Liszt
Indeed. This will be our basis for restarting the zero-point reactor... The last torch of humanity's future is burning 363,300 kilometers from the earth now—right there on the Moon.
All the council members gasp, almost all of them turning toward the Moon that is seemingly just outside their grasp.

To test how zero-point energy would perform under low gravity in space, Babylonia's zero-point reactor and the manufacture of its engine were sent to the propulsion lab on the Moon during Babylonia's production.

Upon discovering the connection between zero-point reactors and the Punishing Virus, the reactor and the lunar base that housed it have been discarded, now managed by Norman Mining Corp, the lunar mining company.
Nikola
(Hmph... Is that why Norman's eldest has been invited to this meeting?)
Noticing Nikola's piercing gaze, Norman, who is playing with the switch of the monitor before him, waves and smiles at Nikola.
Liszt
With Norman Mining Corp's generous assistance, we had a chance to test our theory—and our tests have shown the most promising results.
The projected graphs shift once again, displaying a list of data and a photo of a dazzling blue light—the signature optical effect when zero-point energy is generated.
Liszt
Our test finds the lunar reactor running only at 45.37% of its theoretical capacity when replicating the data from the Atlantis reactor.
Liszt
But that is enough to sustain Babylonia's current operation and future voyage—the most important thing is there has been no sign of the Punishing Virus at our test site, which means...
Liszt
We can attach the zero-point engine to Babylonia and use its almost-limitless energy to turn Babylonia back into a colony ship as we set sail for the stars away from Earth.

This will mean the Punishing Virues-infected planet and its myriad of dangers will no longer concern Babylonia. Humanity would begin anew—which is undoubtedly a very tempting proposition given the current situation.
Nikola

Hmph... Only if your data is reliable. Even the Norman Mining Corp doesn't possess researchers experienced with zero-point reactors and colony ships. I have every right to doubt the legitimacy of this report.
Nikola might have called them Norman Mining Corp's researchers, but he knows very well that it must be Kurono scientists on the lunar surface right now.
Liszt

Our researchers aren't the only ones... We only managed to restart this project because we received assistance from an expert on Babylonia and zero-point energy. Commander Nikola must know our expert very well.
Only now does Nikola realize. He always thought that he was the one using Kurono, but he was never aware that Kuono was using him as well.
Nikola
Karenina...
Liszt

Indeed. Karenina from the Engineering Force might be the most knowledgeable person on Babylonia's design. And despite the study on zero-point energy having stopped for years, she remains one of its leading researchers.
More importantly, Karenina is a member of Babylonia. Her position is above reproach...
Liszt
Well, I believe the idea to relaunch Babylonia's voyage is convincing enough for a proposal then, President Hassen?
Hassen nods as he looks around the Parliament.
Hassen
We'll begin our vote on Councilman Liszt's proposal.
Without much discussion, an overwhelming majority has voted to restart the zero-point reactor and leave the ever-growing threats of the surface, turning humanity's gaze toward the unknown stars.
Hilda

I'll also vote yes... but as the head of the Control Court, I should remind you that you have overstepped your role as a member of the Diplomatic Court by plotting this secret scheme of yours. There will be consequences.
Liszt nods, his gaze moving past Hilda onto Hassen, showing no signs of fear.
Liszt
Of course. I accept any punishment.
Gestalt
98.5% are in favor of Councilman Liszt's proposal, 0% have opposed, and 1.5% have abstained. The supporting rate is higher than the minimum requirements. This proposal has passed.
Hassen
In that case, I hereby announce that...
At that moment, the Parliament suddenly receives an emergency comms request from Celica. Hassen hesitates for a few seconds before deciding to answer the call.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg
Celica
President Hassen! We just received an urgent message from the lunar base. Our initial assessment believes it requires an immediate response!
Hassen
Who sent it?
Celica
Karenina!
Frowning, Hassen looks at Liszt, but he cannot derive anything from Liszt's expressionless face.
Hassen
Play it.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory545.jpg
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory587.jpg
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStory/FxUiHuaping.prefab
Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryTongxunHalfNew.prefab
Celica switches the feed, and the projected screen in the Parliament reveals a blurred figure whose voice is unmistakably Karenina's.
Karenina
...infection... must... danger the surface... so...
Karenina
...I must destroy... the zero-point engine... right now!
